meanings.definition: A rhetorical figure in which the syntactic relation between two words is reversed.
meanings.sent1: In the poem, the hypallage created a unique and memorable expression.
meanings.sent2: The hypallage in the sentence confused the readers at first.
meanings.sent3: The hypallage in the story made the characters' dialogue sound amusingly mixed up.
meanings.sent4: Her use of hypallage in her writing painted a vivid picture of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The hypallage added a touch of creativity to the otherwise straightforward text.

meanings.definition: The use of a word in a grammatical relation different from that which is logically appropriate.
meanings.sent1: The hypallage in the sentence made it grammatically incorrect but artistically interesting.
meanings.sent2: His hypallage of 'sun' as a verb instead of a noun was quite clever.
meanings.sent3: The hypallage in the dialogue between the characters added a humorous twist.
meanings.sent4: Using hypallage in poetry can create striking and unexpected imagery.
meanings.sent5: Her hypallage of 'silence' as a loud sound was a memorable literary device.
